translated: I was one who wore bark cloth;
Having gone up to the path of walking meditation,
Having seen the One Well-Gone on the mountain,
Phussa, who was intent on meditation,
Having raised my hands in respectful salutation,
I gladdened my mind and pleased Raṁsa.
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of the perception of Raṁsa.
The Buddha’s instruction has been fulfilled.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā raṁsisaññako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā rasisaññakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus the elder Raṁsisaññaka recited these verses.
The Elder Raṁsisaññaka’s Story, the sixth.
